     2→  <article class="application-document">
     3→    <!-- Applicant Header Section -->
     4→    <header class="application-header">
     5→      <div class="applicant-info">
     6→        <h1 class="applicant-name">{{ data.applicant.name }}</h1>
     7→
     8→        <!-- Applicant Address -->
     9→        <address v-if="data.applicant.address" class="applicant-address">
    10→          {{ data.applicant.address.street }}<br>
    11→          {{ data.applicant.address.city }}, {{ data.applicant.address.state }} {{ data.applicant.address.zipCode }}
    12→        </address>
    13→
    14→        <!-- Contact Information -->
    15→        <div v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation" class="contact-information">
    16→          <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone" class="phone">
    17→            {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.phone }}
    18→          </span>
    19→          <span v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.phone && data.applicant.contactInformation.email" class="separator"> | </span>
    20→          <a
    21→            v-if="data.applicant.contactInformation.email"
    22→            :href="`mailto:${data.applicant.contactInformation.email}`"
    23→            class="email"
    24→          >
    25→            {{ data.applicant.contactInformation.email }}
    26→          </a>
    27→        </div>
    28→      </div>
    29→    </header>
    30→
    31→    <!-- Document Date -->
    32→    <div v-if="data.date" class="document-date">
    33→      {{ data.date }}
    34→    </div>
    35→
    36→    <!-- Recipient Section -->
    37→    <div v-if="data.recipient" class="recipient">
    38→      <p v-if="data.recipient.position" class="recipient-position">{{ data.recipient.position }}</p>
    39→      <p v-if="data.recipient.company" class="recipient-company">{{ data.recipient.company }}</p>
    40→      <address v-if="data.recipient.address" class="recipient-address">
    41→        {{ data.recipient.address.street }}<br>
    42→        {{ data.recipient.address.city }}, {{ data.recipient.address.state }} {{ data.recipient.address.zipCode }}
    43→      </address>
    44→    </div>
    45→
    46→    <!-- Letter Content -->
    47→    <main v-if="data.letter" class="letter">
    48→      <!-- Salutation -->
    49→      <p v-if="data.letter.salutation" class="salutation">
    50→        {{ data.letter.salutation }}
    51→      </p>
    52→
    53→      <!-- Introduction -->
    54→      <p v-if="data.letter.introduction" class="introduction">
    55→        {{ data.letter.introduction }}
    56→      </p>
    57→
    58→      <!-- Experience Section -->
    59→      <div v-if="data.letter.experienceSection && data.letter.experienceSection.length > 0" class="experience-section">
    60→        <div
    61→          v-for="(experience, expIndex) in data.letter.experienceSection"
    62→          :key="expIndex"
    63→          class="experience"
    64→        >
    65→          <p v-if="experience.employer" class="experience-employer">
    66→            <strong>{{ experience.employer }}</strong>
    67→          </p>
    68→          <ul v-if="experience.achievements && experience.achievements.length > 0" class="achievements">
    69→            <li
    70→              v-for="(achievement, achIndex) in experience.achievements"
    71→              :key="achIndex"
    72→              class="achievement"
    73→            >
    74→              {{ achievement.text }}
    75→            </li>
    76→          </ul>
    77→        </div>
    78→      </div>
    79→
    80→      <!-- Motivation -->
    81→      <p v-if="data.letter.motivation" class="motivation">
    82→        {{ data.letter.motivation }}
    83→      </p>
    84→
    85→      <!-- Closing -->
    86→      <p v-if="data.letter.closing" class="closing">
    87→        {{ data.letter.closing }}
    88→      </p>
    89→
    90→      <!-- Signature -->
    91→      <p v-if="data.letter.signature" class="signature">
    92→        {{ data.letter.signature }}
    93→      </p>
    94→    </main>
    95→  </article>
    96→</template>
    97→
    98→<script setup lang="ts">
    99→import type { ParsedData } from \'~/composables/useXmlParser\'
   100→
   101→/**
   102→ * Modern Template Component
   103→ *
   104→ * Renders a cover letter in a modern, professional style.
   105→ * Uses only standard HTML elements and scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui components).
   106→ * This ensures the template can be exported as standalone HTML.
   107→ */
   108→
   109→interface Props {
   110→  data: ParsedData
   111→}
   112→
   113→defineProps<Props>()
   114→</script>
   115→
   116→<style scoped>
   117→@import \'./styles.css\';
   118→</style>

USERMESSAGE 04:26:39
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * Modern Template Styles
     3→ *
     4→ * Professional cover letter styling using the design system from PRD.md
     5→ * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec
     6→ * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif
     7→ *
     8→ * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)
     9→ * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.
    10→ */
    11→
    12→/* CSS Custom Properties (Design System) */
    13→:root {
    14→  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
    15→  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji";
    16→  --max-width: 720px;
    17→  --ink: #111;
    18→  --muted: #555;
    19→  --accent: #0f6fec;
    20→  --gap: 0.9rem;
    21→  --gap-lg: 1.25rem;
    22→  --line: 1.6;
    23→}
    24→
    25→/* Base Styles */
    26→* {
    27→  box-sizing: border-box;
    28→}
    29→
    30→/* Application Document Container */
    31→.application-document {
    32→  margin: 0 auto;
    33→  max-width: var(--max-width);
    34→  background: #fff;
    35→  color: var(--ink);
    36→  font: 16px/var(--line) var(--font-body);
    37→  padding: 2rem 1rem;
    38→}
    39→
    40→/* Application Header */
    41→.application-header {
    42→  display: grid;
    43→  gap: var(--gap);
    44→  margin-bottom: var(--gap-lg);
    45→}
    46→
    47→.applicant-info {
    48→  display: flex;
    49→  flex-direction: column;
    50→  gap: 0.5rem;
    51→}
    52→
    53→/* Applicant Name */
    54→.applicant-name {
    55→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
    56→  font-size: clamp(1.4rem, 2vw + 1rem, 2rem);
    57→  line-height: 1.2;
    58→  margin: 0 0 0.25rem 0;
    59→  font-weight: 600;
    60→  color: var(--ink);
    61→}
    62→
    63→/* Address Styling */
    64→.applicant-address,
    65→.recipient-address {
    66→  font-style: normal;
    67→  color: var(--muted);
    68→  line-height: 1.5;
    69→  margin: 0;
    70→}
    71→
    72→/* Contact Information */
    73→.contact-information {
    74→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
    75→  color: var(--muted);
    76→  margin: 0.25rem 0 0 0;
    77→  font-size: 0.95rem;
    78→}
    79→
    80→.contact-information .phone {
    81→  color: inherit;
    82→}
    83→
    84→.contact-information .separator {
    85→  margin: 0 0.5rem;
    86→  color: var(--muted);
    87→}
    88→
    89→.contact-information .email {
    90→  color: inherit;
    91→  text-decoration: none;
    92→  border-bottom: 1px dotted currentColor;
    93→  transition: color 0.2s ease;
    94→}
    95→
    96→.contact-information .email:hover {
    97→  color: var(--accent);
    98→}
    99→
   100→/* Document Date */
   101→.document-date {
   102→  margin: var(--gap) 0;
   103→  color: var(--muted);
   104→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
   105→  font-size: 0.95rem;
   106→}
   107→
   108→/* Recipient Section */
   109→.recipient {
   110→  margin-top: 0.25rem;
   111→  margin-bottom: var(--gap-lg);
   112→}
   113→
   114→.recipient-position {
   115→  margin: 0 0 0.1rem 0;
   116→  font-weight: 600;
   117→  color: var(--ink);
   118→}
   119→
   120→.recipient-company {
   121→  margin: 0.1rem 0 0.2rem 0;
   122→  font-family: var(--font-ui);
   123→  color: var(--ink);
   124→}
   125→
   126→/* Letter Content */
   127→.letter {
   128→  margin-top: var(--gap-lg);
   129→}
   130→
   131→.letter > p {
   132→  margin: 0 0 1rem 0;
   133→  line-height: var(--line);
   134→}
   135→
   136→/* Salutation */
   137→.salutation {
   138→  margin-bottom: 1rem;
   139→  font-weight: 500;
   140→}
   141→
   142→/* Introduction */
   143→.introduction {
   144→  margin-bottom: 1rem;
   145→}
   146→
   147→/* Experience Section */
   148→.experience-section {
   149→  margin: 1rem 0;
   150→}
   151→
   152→.experience {
   153→  margin-bottom: 1rem;
   154→}
   155→
   156→.experience-employer {
   157→  margin: 0 0 0.25rem 0;
   158→  color: var(--ink);
   159→}
   160→
   161→.experience-employer strong {
   162→  font-weight: 600;
   163→}
   164→
   165→/* Achievements List */
   166→.achievements {
   167→  margin: 0.25rem 0 1rem 1.5rem;
   168→  padding: 0;
   169→  list-style-type: disc;
   170→}
   171→
   172→.achievement {
   173→  margin: 0.2rem 0;
   174→  line-height: var(--line);
   175→  color: var(--ink);
   176→}
   177→
   178→/* Motivation */
   179→.motivation {
   180→  margin-bottom: 1rem;
   181→}
   182→
   183→/* Closing */
   184→.closing {
   185→  margin-bottom: 1rem;
   186→}
   187→
   188→/* Signature */
   189→.signature {
   190→  margin-top: 2.5rem;
   191→  font-weight: 600;
   192→  color: var(--ink);
   193→}
   194→
   195→/* Print Optimization */
   196→@media print {
   197→  .application-document {
   198→    padding: 0;
   199→    max-width: none;
   200→    margin: 0 2cm;
   201→  }
   202→
   203→  .contact-information .email {
   204→    color: inherit;
   205→    text-decoration: none;
   206→    border-bottom: none;
   207→  }
   208→}
   209→
   210→/* Responsive Design */
   211→@media screen and (max-width: 768px) {
   212→  .application-document {
   213→    padding: 1rem 0.75rem;
   214→  }
   215→
   216→  .applicant-name {
   217→    font-size: 1.5rem;
   218→  }
   219→}
   220→

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

USERMESSAGE 04:26:39
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * Template System Composable
     3→ *
     4→ * Provides template selection and management for document rendering.
     5→ * PoC Implementation: Uses code-level template switching via ACTIVE_TEMPLATE constant.
     6→ * (See DECISIONS.md Decision 4: UI dropdown is post-PoC feature)
     7→ */
     8→
     9→import type { Component } from \'vue\'
    10→import CoverLetterModern from \'~/templates/modern/CoverLetterModern.vue\'
    11→
    12→// Template metadata interface for future extensibility
    13→export interface TemplateMetadata {
    14→  name: string
    15→  displayName: string
    16→  description: string
    17→}
    18→
    19→// Template registry type
    20→export interface TemplateRegistry {
    21→  [key: string]: {
    22→    component: Component
    23→    metadata: TemplateMetadata
    24→  }
    25→}
    26→
    27→/**
    28→ * ACTIVE_TEMPLATE Constant
    29→ *
    30→ * Change this constant to switch templates in the PoC.
    31→ * Available options: \'modern\' (more templates will be added in MVP 11)
    32→ *
    33→ * Example:
    34→ *   const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \'modern\'  // Uses Modern template
    35→ *   const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \'classic\' // Uses Classic template (when available)
    36→ */
    37→const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \'modern\'
    38→
    39→/**
    40→ * Template Registry
    41→ *
    42→ * Maps template names to their Vue components and metadata.
    43→ * Templates will be registered here as they are implemented.
    44→ */
    45→const templates: TemplateRegistry = {
    46→  modern: {
    47→    component: CoverLetterModern,
    48→    metadata: {
    49→      name: \'modern\',
    50→      displayName: \'Modern\',
    51→      description: \'Professional cover letter template with modern styling and clean typography\',
    52→    },
    53→  },
    54→  // Additional templates (Classic, Minimal) will be added in MVP 11
    55→}
    56→
    57→/**
    58→ * Get the currently active template component
    59→ *
    60→ * @returns The Vue component for the active template
    61→ * @throws Error if the active template is not found in the registry
    62→ */
    63→export function getCurrentTemplate(): Component {
    64→  const templateEntry = templates[ACTIVE_TEMPLATE]
    65→
    66→  if (!templateEntry) {
    67→    throw new Error(
    68→      `Template "${ACTIVE_TEMPLATE}" not found. Available templates: ${Object.keys(templates).join(\', \')}`
    69→    )
    70→  }
    71→
    72→  return templateEntry.component
    73→}
    74→
    75→/**
    76→ * Get metadata for the currently active template
    77→ *
    78→ * @returns Template metadata for the active template
    79→ */
    80→export function getCurrentTemplateMetadata(): TemplateMetadata {
    81→  const templateEntry = templates[ACTIVE_TEMPLATE]
    82→
    83→  if (!templateEntry) {
    84→    throw new Error(
    85→      `Template "${ACTIVE_TEMPLATE}" not found. Available templates: ${Object.keys(templates).join(\', \')}`
    86→    )
    87→  }
    88→
    89→  return templateEntry.metadata
    90→}
    91→
    92→/**
    93→ * Get all available template names
    94→ *
    95→ * @returns Array of template names
    96→ */
    97→export function getAvailableTemplates(): string[] {
    98→  return Object.keys(templates)
    99→}
   100→
   101→/**
   102→ * Get metadata for all available templates
   103→ *
   104→ * @returns Array of template metadata objects
   105→ */
   106→export function getAllTemplateMetadata(): TemplateMetadata[] {
   107→  return Object.values(templates).map(t => t.metadata)
   108→}
   109→
   110→/**
   111→ * Composable function to use template system in Vue components
   112→ *
   113→ * @returns Object with template selection functions
   114→ */
   115→export function useTemplate() {
   116→  return {
   117→    getCurrentTemplate,
   118→    getCurrentTemplateMetadata,
   119→    getAvailableTemplates,
   120→    getAllTemplateMetadata,
   121→    activeTemplate: ACTIVE_TEMPLATE,
   122→  }
   123→}
   124→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

68\u2192      `Template \"${ACTIVE_TEMPLATE}\" not found. Available templates: ${Object.keys(templates).join(\\', \\')}`\\n    69\u2192    )\\n    70\u2192  }\\n    71\u2192\\n    72\u2192  return templateEntry.component\\n    73\u2192}\\n    74\u2192\\n    75\u2192/**\\n    76\u2192 * Get metadata for the currently active template\\n    77\u2192 *\\n    78\u2192 * @returns Template metadata for the active template\\n    79\u2192 */\\n    80\u2192export function getCurrentTemplateMetadata(): TemplateMetadata {\\n    81\u2192  const templateEntry = templates[ACTIVE_TEMPLATE]\\n    82\u2192\\n    83\u2192  if (!templateEntry) {\\n    84\u2192    throw new Error(\\n    85\u2192      `Template \"${ACTIVE_TEMPLATE}\" not found. Available templates: ${Object.keys(templates).join(\\', \\')}`\\n    86\u2192    )\\n    87\u2192  }\\n    88\u2192\\n    89\u2192  return templateEntry.metadata\\n    90\u2192}\\n    91\u2192\\n    92\u2192/**\\n    93\u2192 * Get all available template names\\n    94\u2192 *\\n    95\u2192 * @returns Array of template names\\n    96\u2192 */\\n    97\u2192export function getAvailableTemplates(): string[] {\\n    98\u2192  return Object.keys(templates)\\n    99\u2192}\\n   100\u2192\\n   101\u2192/**\\n   102\u2192 * Get metadata for all available templates\\n   103\u2192 *\\n   104\u2192 * @returns Array of template metadata objects\\n   105\u2192 */\\n   106\u2192export function getAllTemplateMetadata(): TemplateMetadata[] {\\n   107\u2192  return Object.values(templates).map(t => t.metadata)\\n   108\u2192}\\n   109\u2192\\n   110\u2192/**\\n   111\u2192 * Composable function to use template system in Vue components\\n   112\u2192 *\\n   113\u2192 * @returns Object with template selection functions\\n   114\u2192 */\\n   115\u2192export function useTemplate() {\\n   116\u2192  return {\\n   117\u2192    getCurrentTemplate,\\n   118\u2192    getCurrentTemplateMetadata,\\n   119\u2192    getAvailableTemplates,\\n   120\u2192    getAllTemplateMetadata,\\n   121\u2192    activeTemplate: ACTIVE_TEMPLATE,\\n   122\u2192  }\\n   123\u2192}\\n   124\u2192\\n\\n<system-reminder>\\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\\n</system-reminder>\\n', is_error=None)]",
  "parent_tool_use_id": null
}

  "content": "[ToolUseBlock(id='toolu_01P7RoN5f5FdeipPhtDtu641', name='Read', input={'file_path': '/home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/composables/useXmlParser.ts'})]",
  "model": "claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929",

USERMESSAGE 04:26:44
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→/**
     2→ * XML Parser Composable
     3→ *
     4→ * Provides XML parsing functionality using browser's native DOMParser API.
     5→ * Zero dependencies approach for fast, simple XML parsing (DECISIONS.md Decision 6).
     6→ */
     7→
     8→// TypeScript interfaces matching the XML schema from docs/sample/cover-letter.xml
     9→
    10→export interface Address {
    11→  street: string
    12→  city: string
    13→  state: string
    14→  zipCode: string
    15→}
    16→
    17→export interface ContactInformation {
    18→  phone: string
    19→  email: string
    20→}
    21→
    22→export interface Applicant {
    23→  name: string
    24→  address: Address
    25→  contactInformation: ContactInformation
    26→}
    27→
    28→export interface Achievement {
    29→  text: string
    30→}
    31→
    32→export interface Experience {
    33→  employer: string
    34→  achievements: Achievement[]
    35→}
    36→
    37→export interface Letter {
    38→  salutation: string
    39→  introduction: string
    40→  experienceSection: Experience[]
    41→  motivation: string
    42→  closing: string
    43→  signature: string
    44→}
    45→
    46→export interface Recipient {
    47→  position: string
    48→  company: string
    49→  address: Address
    50→}
    51→
    52→export interface ParsedData {
    53→  formatStyle?: string
    54→  applicant: Applicant
    55→  date: string
    56→  recipient: Recipient
    57→  letter: Letter
    58→}
    59→
    60→export interface ValidationResult {
    61→  isValid: boolean
    62→  error?: string
    63→}
    64→
    65→export interface ParseResult {
    66→  success: boolean
    67→  data?: ParsedData
    68→  error?: string
    69→}
    70→
    71→/**
    72→ * Helper function to safely extract text content from an XML element
    73→ */
    74→function getTextContent(element: Element | null, tagName: string, parentName: string = 'document'): string {
    75→  if (!element) {
    76→    throw new Error(`Missing required element: ${tagName} in ${parentName}`)
    77→  }
    78→  const node = element.querySelector(tagName)
    79→  if (!node) {
    80→    throw new Error(`Missing required element: ${tagName} in ${parentName}`)
    81→  }
    82→  return node.textContent?.trim() || ''
    83→}
    84→
    85→/**
    86→ * Parse address element (reusable for applicant and recipient addresses)
    87→ */
    88→function parseAddress(addressElement: Element | null, context: string): Address {
    89→  if (!addressElement) {
    90→    throw new Error(`Missing address element in ${context}`)
    91→  }
    92→
    93→  return {
    94→    street: getTextContent(addressElement, 'street', `${context} address`),
    95→    city: getTextContent(addressElement, 'city', `${context} address`),
    96→    state: getTextContent(addressElement, 'state', `${context} address`),
    97→    zipCode: getTextContent(addressElement, 'zipCode', `${context} address`),
    98→  }
    99→}
   100→
   101→/**
   102→ * Validate XML for well-formedness and basic schema requirements
   103→ *
   104→ * @param xmlString - XML string to validate
   105→ * @returns ValidationResult with isValid flag and optional error message
   106→ */
   107→export function validateXml(xmlString: string): ValidationResult {
   108→  if (!xmlString || xmlString.trim() === '') {
   109→    return {
   110→      isValid: false,
   111→      error: 'XML input is empty. Please provide valid XML content.',
   112→    }
   113→  }
   114→
   115→  const parser = new DOMParser()
   116→  const xmlDoc = parser.parseFromString(xmlString, 'text/xml')
   117→
   118→  // Check for parser errors
   119→  const parserError = xmlDoc.querySelector('parsererror')
   120→  if (parserError) {
   121→    // Extract meaningful error message from parsererror element
   122→    const errorText = parserError.textContent || 'Unknown XML parsing error'
   123→
   124→    // Provide user-friendly error messages for common issues
   125→    if (errorText.includes('unclosed tag') || errorText.includes('Opening and ending tag mismatch')) {
   126→      return {
   127→        isValid: false,
   128→        error: 'XML has unclosed or mismatched tags. Please check that all opening tags have corresponding closing tags.',
   129→      }
   130→    }
   131→    if (errorText.includes('Unexpected end of file') || errorText.includes('premature end of data')) {
   132→      return {
   133→        isValid: false,
   134→        error: 'XML is incomplete. The document appears to end unexpectedly.',
   135→      }
   136→    }
   137→    if (errorText.includes('invalid character') || errorText.includes('not well-formed')) {
   138→      return {
   139→        isValid: false,
   140→        error: 'XML contains invalid characters or syntax. Please check for special characters that need to be escaped.',
   141→      }
   142→    }
   143→
   144→    return {
   145→      isValid: false,
   146→      error: `XML parsing error: ${errorText}`,
   147→    }
   148→  }
   149→
   150→  // Check for root element
   151→  const root = xmlDoc.documentElement
   152→  if (!root || root.tagName !== 'applicationDocument') {
   153→    return {
   154→      isValid: false,
   155→      error: 'Invalid XML structure. Root element must be <applicationDocument>.',
   156→    }
   157→  }
   158→
   159→  // Check for required top-level elements
   160→  const requiredElements = ['applicant', 'date', 'recipient', 'letter']
   161→  for (const elementName of requiredElements) {
   162→    if (!root.querySelector(elementName)) {
   163→      return {
   164→        isValid: false,
   165→        error: `Missing required element: <${elementName}>. All application documents must include applicant, date, recipient, and letter sections.`,
   166→      }
   167→    }
   168→  }
   169→
   170→  return { isValid: true }
   171→}
   172→
   173→/**
   174→ * Parse XML string into structured data object
   175→ *
   176→ * @param xmlString - XML string to parse
   177→ * @returns ParseResult with success flag, parsed data, or error message
   178→ */
   179→export function parseXml(xmlString: string): ParseResult {
   180→  try {
   181→    // First validate the XML
   182→    const validation = validateXml(xmlString)
   183→    if (!validation.isValid) {
   184→      return {
   185→        success: false,
   186→        error: validation.error,
   187→      }
   188→    }
   189→
   190→    const parser = new DOMParser()
   191→    const xmlDoc = parser.parseFromString(xmlString, 'text/xml')
   192→    const root = xmlDoc.documentElement
   193→
   194→    // Extract formatStyle attribute (optional)
   195→    const formatStyle = root.getAttribute('formatStyle') || undefined
   196→
   197→    // Parse applicant section
   198→    const applicantElement = root.querySelector('applicant')
   199→    if (!applicantElement) {
   200→      throw new Error('Missing required element: applicant')
   201→    }
   202→
   203→    const applicant: Applicant = {
   204→      name: getTextContent(applicantElement, 'name', 'applicant'),
   205→      address: parseAddress(applicantElement.querySelector('address'), 'applicant'),
   206→      contactInformation: {
   207→        phone: getTextContent(applicantElement, 'contactInformation phone', 'applicant'),
   208→        email: getTextContent(applicantElement, 'contactInformation email', 'applicant'),
   209→      },
   210→    }
   211→
   212→    // Parse date
   213→    const date = getTextContent(root, 'date')
   214→
   215→    // Parse recipient section
   216→    const recipientElement = root.querySelector('recipient')
   217→    if (!recipientElement) {
   218→      throw new Error('Missing required element: recipient')
   219→    }
   220→
   221→    const recipient: Recipient = {
   222→      position: getTextContent(recipientElement, 'position', 'recipient'),
   223→      company: getTextContent(recipientElement, 'company', 'recipient'),
   224→      address: parseAddress(recipientElement.querySelector('address'), 'recipient'),
   225→    }
   226→
   227→    // Parse letter section
   228→    const letterElement = root.querySelector('letter')
   229→    if (!letterElement) {
   230→      throw new Error('Missing required element: letter')
   231→    }
   232→
   233→    // Parse experiences
   234→    const experienceElements = letterElement.querySelectorAll('experienceSection experience')
   235→    const experiences: Experience[] = Array.from(experienceElements).map((expElement) => {
   236→      const employer = expElement.querySelector('employer')?.textContent?.trim() || ''
   237→      const achievementElements = expElement.querySelectorAll('achievements achievement')
   238→      const achievements: Achievement[] = Array.from(achievementElements).map(ach => ({
   239→        text: ach.textContent?.trim() || '',
   240→      }))
   241→
   242→      return {
   243→        employer,
   244→        achievements,
   245→      }
   246→    })
   247→
   248→    const letter: Letter = {
   249→      salutation: getTextContent(letterElement, 'salutation', 'letter'),
   250→      introduction: getTextContent(letterElement, 'introduction', 'letter'),
   251→      experienceSection: experiences,
   252→      motivation: getTextContent(letterElement, 'motivation', 'letter'),
   253→      closing: getTextContent(letterElement, 'closing', 'letter'),
   254→      signature: getTextContent(letterElement, 'signature', 'letter'),
   255→    }
   256→
   257→    const parsedData: ParsedData = {
   258→      formatStyle,
   259→      applicant,
   260→      date,
   261→      recipient,
   262→      letter,
   263→    }
   264→
   265→    return {
   266→      success: true,
   267→      data: parsedData,
   268→    }
   269→  }
   270→  catch (error) {
   271→    const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error occurred during parsing'
   272→    return {
   273→      success: false,
   274→      error: `Failed to parse XML: ${errorMessage}`,
   275→    }
   276→  }
   277→}
   278→
   279→/**
   280→ * Composable function to use XML parser in Vue components
   281→ */
   282→export function useXmlParser() {
   283→  return {
   284→    parseXml,
   285→    validateXml,
   286→  }
   287→}
   288→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

107\u2192export function validateXml(xmlString: string): ValidationResult {\\n   108\u2192  if (!xmlString || xmlString.trim() === '') {\\n   109\u2192    return {\\n   110\u2192      isValid: Please provide valid XML content.',\\n   112\u2192    }\\n   113\u2192  }\\n   114\u2192\\n   115\u2192  const parser = new DOMParser()\\n   116\u2192  const xmlDoc = parser.parseFromString(xmlString, 'text/xml')\\n   117\u2192\\n   118\u2192  // Check for parser errors\\n   119\u2192  const parserError = xmlDoc.querySelector('parsererror')\\n   120\u2192  if (parserError) {\\n   121\u2192    // Extract meaningful error message from parsererror element\\n   122\u2192    const errorText = parserError.textContent || 'Unknown XML parsing error'\\n   123\u2192\\n   124\u2192    // Provide user-friendly error messages for common issues\\n   125\u2192    if (errorText.includes('unclosed tag') || errorText.includes('Opening and ending tag mismatch')) {\\n   126\u2192      return {\\n   127\u2192        isValid: false,\\n   128\u2192        error: 'XML has unclosed or mismatched tags. Please check that all opening tags have corresponding closing tags.',\\n   129\u2192      }\\n   130\u2192    }\\n   131\u2192    if (errorText.includes('Unexpected end of file') || errorText.includes('premature end of data')) {\\n   132\u2192      return {\\n   133\u2192        isValid: false,\\n   134\u2192        error: 'XML is incomplete. The document appears to end unexpectedly.',\\n   135\u2192      }\\n   136\u2192    }\\n   137\u2192    if (errorText.includes('invalid character') || errorText.includes('not well-formed')) {\\n   138\u2192      return {\\n   139\u2192        isValid: false,\\n   140\u2192        error: 'XML contains invalid characters or syntax. Please check for special characters that need to be escaped.',\\n   141\u2192      }\\n   142\u2192    }\\n   143\u2192\\n   144\u2192    return {\\n   145\u2192      isValid: false,\\n   146\u2192      error: `XML parsing error: ${errorText}`,\\n   147\u2192    }\\n   148\u2192  }\\n   149\u2192\\n   150\u2192  // Check for root element\\n   151\u2192  const root = xmlDoc.documentElement\\n   152\u2192  if (!root || root.tagName !== 'applicationDocument') {\\n   153\u2192    return {\\n   154\u2192      isValid: false,\\n   155\u2192      error: 'Invalid XML structure. Root element must be <applicationDocument>.',\\n   156\u2192    }\\n   157\u2192  }\\n   158\u2192\\n   159\u2192  // Check for required top-level elements\\n   160\u2192  const requiredElements = ['applicant', 'date', 'recipient', 'letter']\\n   161\u2192  for (const elementName of requiredElements) {\\n   162\u2192    if (!root.querySelector(elementName)) {\\n   163\u2192      return {\\n   164\u2192        isValid: false,\\n   165\u2192        error: `Missing required element: <${elementName}>. All application documents must include applicant, date, recipient, and letter sections.`,\\n   166\u2192      }\\n   167\u2192    }\\n   168\u2192  }\\n   169\u2192\\n   170\u2192  return { isValid: true }\\n   171\u2192}\\n   172\u2192\\n   173\u2192/**\\n   174\u2192 * Parse XML string into structured data object\\n   175\u2192 *\\n   176\u2192 * @param xmlString - XML string to parse\\n   177\u2192 * @returns ParseResult with success flag, parsed data, or error message\\n   178\u2192 */\\n   179\u2192export function parseXml(xmlString: string): ParseResult {\\n   180\u2192  try {\\n   181\u2192    // First validate the XML\\n   182\u2192    const validation = validateXml(xmlString)\\n   183\u2192    if (!validation.isValid) {\\n   184\u2192      return {\\n   185\u2192        success: false,\\n   186\u2192        error: validation.error,\\n   187\u2192      }\\n   188\u2192    }\\n   189\u2192\\n   190\u2192    const parser = new DOMParser()\\n   191\u2192    const xmlDoc = parser.parseFromString(xmlString, 'text/xml')\\n   192\u2192    const root = xmlDoc.documentElement\\n   193\u2192\\n   194\u2192    // Extract formatStyle attribute (optional)\\n   195\u2192 root.querySelector('applicant')\\n   199\u2192    if (!applicantElement) {\\n   200\u2192      throw new Error('Missing required element: applicant')\\n   201\u2192    }\\n   202\u2192\\n   203\u2192    const applicant: Applicant = {\\n   204\u2192      name: getTextContent(applicantElement, 'name', 'applicant'),\\n   205\u2192      address: parseAddress(applicantElement.querySelector('address'), 'applicant'),\\n   206\u2192      contactInformation: {\\n   207\u2192        phone: getTextContent(applicantElement, 'contactInformation phone', 'applicant'),\\n   208\u2192        email: getTextContent(applicantElement, 'contactInformation email', 'applicant'),\\n   209\u2192      },\\n   210\u2192    }\\n   211\u2192\\n   212\u2192    // Parse date\\n   213\u2192    const date = getTextContent(root, 'date')\\n   214\u2192\\n   215\u2192    // Parse recipient section\\n   216\u2192    const recipientElement = root.querySelector('recipient')\\n   217\u2192    if (!recipientElement) {\\n   218\u2192      throw new Error('Missing required element: recipient')\\n   219\u2192    }\\n   220\u2192\\n   221\u2192    const recipient: Recipient = {\\n   222\u2192      position: getTextContent(recipientElement, 'position', 'recipient'),\\n   223\u2192      company: getTextContent(recipientElement, 'company', 'recipient'),\\n   224\u2192      address: parseAddress(recipientElement.querySelector('address'), 'recipient'),\\n   225\u2192    }\\n   226\u2192\\n   227\u2192    // Parse letter section\\n   228\u2192    const letterElement = root.querySelector('letter')\\n   229\u2192    if (!letterElement) {\\n   230\u2192      throw new Error('Missing required element: letter')\\n   231\u2192    }\\n   232\u2192\\n   233\u2192    // Parse experiences\\n   234\u2192    const experienceElements = letterElement.querySelectorAll('experienceSection experience')\\n   235\u2192    const experiences: Experience[] = Array.from(experienceElements).map((expElement) => {\\n   236\u2192      const employer = expElement.querySelector('employer')?.textContent?.trim() || ''\\n   237\u2192      const achievementElements = expElement.querySelectorAll('achievements achievement')\\n   238\u2192      const achievements: Achievement[] = Array.from(achievementElements).map(ach => ({\\n   239\u2192        text: ach.textContent?.trim() || '',\\n   240\u2192      }))\\n   241\u2192\\n   242\u2192      return {\\n   243\u2192        employer,\\n   244\u2192        achievements,\\n   245\u2192      }\\n   246\u2192    })\\n   247\u2192\\n   248\u2192    const letter: Letter = {\\n   249\u2192      salutation: getTextContent(letterElement, 'salutation', 'letter'),\\n   250\u2192      introduction: getTextContent(letterElement, 'introduction', 'letter'),\\n   251\u2192      experienceSection: experiences,\\n   252\u2192      motivation: getTextContent(letterElement, 'motivation', 'letter'),\\n   253\u2192      closing: getTextContent(letterElement, 'closing', 'letter'),\\n   254\u2192      signature: getTextContent(letterElement, 'signature', 'letter'),\\n   255\u2192    }\\n   256\u2192\\n   257\u2192    const parsedData: ParsedData = {\\n   258\u2192      formatStyle,\\n   259\u2192      applicant,\\n   260\u2192      date,\\n   261\u2192      recipient,\\n   262\u2192      letter,\\n   263\u2192    }\\n   264\u2192\\n   265\u2192    return {\\n   266\u2192      success: true,\\n   267\u2192      data: parsedData,\\n   268\u2192    }\\n   269\u2192  }\\n   270\u2192  catch (error) {\\n   271\u2192    const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error occurred during parsing'\\n   272\u2192    return {\\n   273\u2192      success: false,\\n   274\u2192      error: `Failed to parse XML: ${errorMessage}`,\\n   275\u2192    }\\n   276\u2192  }\\n   277\u2192}\\n   278\u2192\\n   279\u2192/**\\n   280\u2192 * Composable function to use XML parser in Vue components\\n   281\u2192 */\\n   282\u2192export function useXmlParser() {\\n   283\u2192  return {\\n   284\u2192    parseXml,\\n   285\u2192    validateXml,\\n   286\u2192  }\\n   287\u2192}\\n   288\u2192\\n\\n<system-reminder>\\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\\n</system-reminder>\\n\", is_error=None)]",
  "parent_tool_use_id": null
}

  "file_path": "/home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/templates/classic/styles.css",
  "content": "/**\n * Classic Template Styles\n *\n * Traditional cover letter styling using table-based layout.\n * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec\n * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif\n *\n * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)\n * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.\n */\n\n/* CSS Custom Properties (Design System) */\n:root {\n  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, \"Times New Roman\", Times, serif;\n  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, \"Apple Color Emoji\", \"Segoe UI Emoji\";\n  --max-width: 720px;\n  --ink: #111;\n  --muted: #555;\n  --accent: #0f6fec;\n  --gap: 0.9rem;\n  --gap-lg: 1.25rem;\n  --line: 1.6;\n}\n\n/* Base Styles */\n* {\n  box-sizing: border-box;\n}\n\n/* Classic Document Container */\n.classic-document {\n  margin: 0 auto;\n  max-width: var(--max-width);\n  background: #fff;\n  color: var(--ink);\n  font: 16px/var(--line) var(--font-body);\n  padding: 2rem 1rem;\n}\n\n/* Table Reset */\ntable {\n  border-collapse: collapse;\n  border-spacing: 0;\n  width: 100%;\n  margin: 0;\n}\n\ntd {\n  padding: 0;\n  vertical-align: top;\n}\n\n/* Header Table */\n.header-table {\n  margin-bottom: var(--gap-lg);\n  border-bottom: 2px solid var(--ink);\n  padding-bottom: var(--gap);\n}\n\n.applicant-section {\n  padding: 0.5rem 0;\n}\n\n.applicant-name {\n  font-family: var(--font-ui);\n  font-size: 1.75rem;\n  line-height: 1.2;\n  margin: 0 0 0.5rem 0;\n  font-weight: 700;\n  color: var(--ink);\n  text-transform: uppercase;\n  letter-spacing: 0.05em;\n}\n\n.address-block {\n  color: var(--muted);\n  line-height: 1.5;\n  margin: 0.5rem 0;\n  font-size: 0.95rem;\n}\n\n.contact-block {\n  font-family: var(--font-ui);\n  color: var(--muted);\n  margin: 0.5rem 0 0 0;\n  font-size: 0.9rem;\n}\n\n.contact-block .phone {\n  color: inherit;\n}\n\n.contact-block .email {\n  color: inherit;\n  text-decoration: underline;\n}\n\n.contact-block .email:hover {\n  color: var(--accent);\n}\n\n/* Date Table */\n.date-table {\n  margin: var(--gap) 0;\n}\n\n.document-date {\n  font-family: var(--font-ui);\n  color: var(--muted);\n  font-size: 0.9rem;\n  padding: 0.5rem 0;\n}\n\n/* Recipient Table */\n.recipient-table {\n  margin: var(--gap) 0 var(--gap-lg) 0;\n  border-left: 3px solid var(--accent);\n  padding-left: 1rem;\n}\n\n.recipient-section {\n  padding: 0.5rem 0;\n}\n\n.recipient-position {\n  font-weight: 700;\n  color: var(--ink);\n  margin: 0 0 0.2rem 0;\n}\n\n.recipient-company {\n  font-family: var(--font-ui);\n  color: var(--ink);\n  margin: 0.2rem 0 0.3rem 0;\n  font-weight: 600;\n}\n\n.recipient-address {\n  color: var(--muted);\n  line-height: 1.5;\n  margin: 0.3rem 0 0 0;\n  font-size: 0.95rem;\n}\n\n/* Letter Content Table */\n.letter-table {\n  margin-top: var(--gap-lg);\n}\n\n.letter-table td {\n  padding: 0 0 1rem 0;\n}\n\n/* Salutation */\n.salutation {\n  font-weight: 600;\n  color: var(--ink);\n}\n\n/* Introduction */\n.introduction {\n  line-height: var(--line);\n}\n\n/* Experience Section */\n.experience-section {\n  padding: 0.5rem 0;\n}\n\n.experience-table {\n  width: 100%;\n}\n\n.experience-block {\n  padding: 0.5rem 0;\n}\n\n.experience-employer {\n  margin: 0 0 0.25rem 0;\n  color: var(--ink);\n}\n\n.experience-employer strong {\n  font-weight: 700;\n}\n\n/* Achievements List */\n.achievements {\n  margin: 0.25rem 0 0.5rem 1.5rem;\n  padding: 0;\n  list-style-type: square;\n}\n\n.achievement {\n  margin: 0.2rem 0;\n  line-height: var(--line);\n  color: var(--ink);\n}\n\n/* Motivation */\n.motivation {\n  line-height: var(--line);\n}\n\n/* Closing */\n.closing {\n  line-height: var(--line);\n}\n\n/* Signature */\n.signature {\n  margin-top: 2rem;\n  font-weight: 700;\n  color: var(--ink);\n  font-family: var(--font-ui);\n  text-align: left;\n}\n\n/* Print Optimization */\n@media print {\n  .classic-document {\n    padding: 0;\n    max-width: none;\n    margin: 0 2cm;\n  }\n\n  .header-table {\n    border-bottom: 2px solid #000;\n  }\n\n  .contact-block   "file_path": "/home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/templates/minimal/styles.css",
  "content": "/**\n * Minimal Template Styles\n *\n * Clean, minimalist cover letter styling with focus on readability and whitespace.\n * Color palette (PRD 4.2): --ink: #111, --muted: #555, --accent: #0f6fec\n * Typography (PRD 4.3): --font-body: ui-serif, --font-ui: ui-sans-serif\n *\n * This stylesheet uses ONLY scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui, no Tailwind utilities)\n * to ensure the template is exportable as standalone HTML.\n */\n\n/* CSS Custom Properties (Design System) */\n:root {\n  --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, \"Times New Roman\", Times, serif;\n  --font-ui: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, \"Apple Color Emoji\", \"Segoe UI Emoji\";\n  --max-width: 680px;\n  --ink: #111;\n  --muted: #555;\n  --accent: #0f6fec;\n  --gap: 1.5rem;\n  --line: 1.7;\n}\n\n/* Base Styles */\n* {\n  box-sizing: border-box;\n}\n\n/* Minimal Document Container */\n.minimal-document {\n  margin: 0 auto;\n  max-width: var(--max-width);\n  background: #fff;\n  color: var(--ink);\n  font: 15px/var(--line) var(--font-body);\n  padding: 3rem 1rem;\n}\n\n/* Applicant Section */\n.applicant-section {\n  margin-bottom: var(--gap);\n}\n\n.applicant-name {\n  font-family: var(--font-ui);\n  font-size: 1.5rem;\n  font-weight: 400;\n  margin-bottom: 0.5rem;\n  color: var(--ink);\n}\n\n.applicant-address {\n  color: var(--muted);\n  line-height: 1.6;\n  margin: 0.5rem 0;\n  font-size: 0.9rem;\n}\n\n.applicant-contact {\n  color: var(--muted);\n  margin: 0.5rem 0;\n  font-size: 0.9rem;\n}\n\n.applicant-contact a {\n  color: inherit;\n  text-decoration: none;\n}\n\n.applicant-contact a:hover {\n  color: var(--accent);\n}\n\n/* Date */\n.document-date {\n  margin: var(--gap) 0;\n  color: var(--muted);\n  font-size: 0.9rem;\n}\n\n/* Recipient Section */\n.recipient-section {\n  margin: var(--gap) 0;\n  color: var(--muted);\n}\n\n.recipient-section > div {\n  margin: 0.2rem 0;\n  font-size: 0.95rem;\n}\n\n.recipient-address {\n  line-height: 1.6;\n  margin-top: 0.3rem;\n}\n\n/* Letter Content */\n.letter-content {\n  margin-top: calc(var(--gap) * 1.5);\n}\n\n.paragraph {\n  margin: var(--gap) 0;\n  line-height: var(--line);\n}\n\n/* Salutation */\n.salutation {\n  margin-bottom: var(--gap);\n  color: var(--ink);\n}\n\n/* Experience Section */\n.experience-section {\n  margin: var(--gap) 0;\n}\n\n.experience-block {\n  margin: 1rem 0;\n}\n\n.employer {\n  font-weight: 600;\n  margin-bottom: 0.5rem;\n  color: var(--ink);\n}\n\n/* Achievements List */\nul {\n  margin: 0.5rem 0 0 1.2rem;\n  padding: 0;\n  list-style-type: none;\n}\n\nli {\n  margin: 0.4rem 0;\n  line-height: var(--line);\n  padding-left: 1rem;\n  position: relative;\n}\n\nli::before {\n  content: \"\u2014\";\n  position: absolute;\n  left: 0;\n  color: var(--muted);\n}\n\n/* Signature */\n.signature {\n  margin-top: calc(var(--gap) * 2);\n  font-weight: 400;\n  color: var(--ink);\n}\n\n/* Print Optimization */\n@media print {\n  .minimal-document {\n    padding: 0;\n    max-width: none;\n    margin: 0 2cm;\n  }\n\n  .applicant-contact a {\n    color: inherit;\n  }\n}\n\n/* Responsive Design */\n@media screen and (max-width: 768px) {\n  .minimal-document {\n    padding: 2rem 1rem;\n  }\n\n  .applicant-name {\n    font-size: 1.3rem;\n  }\n}\n"

     1→<template>
     2→  <div class="debug-template-page">
     3→    <!-- Page Header with @nuxt/ui -->
     4→    <header class="page-header">
     5→      <UContainer>
     6→        <div class="header-content">
     7→          <h1 class="page-title">Template Renderer Demo</h1>
     8→          <p class="page-description">
     9→            Testing the Modern template with comprehensive sample data.
    10→            This page demonstrates template rendering capabilities in isolation.
    11→          </p>
    12→        </div>
    13→      </UContainer>
    14→    </header>
    15→
    16→    <!-- Template Preview Section -->
    17→    <UContainer>
    18→      <div class="template-info">
    19→        <UBadge color="blue" variant="subtle" size="lg">
    20→          Active Template: {{ templateMetadata.displayName }}
    21→        </UBadge>
    22→        <p class="template-description">{{ templateMetadata.description }}</p>
    23→      </div>
    24→
    25→      <!-- Render the active template with sample data -->
    26→      <div class="template-preview">
    27→        <component :is="activeTemplateComponent" :data="sampleData" />
    28→      </div>
    29→
    30→      <!-- Debug Information -->
    31→      <UCard class="debug-info">
    32→        <template #header>
    33→          <h2 class="debug-title">Debug Information</h2>
    34→        </template>
    35→
    36→        <div class="debug-content">
    37→          <div class="debug-section">
    38→            <h3>Template System</h3>
    39→            <ul>
    40→              <li><strong>Active Template:</strong> {{ activeTemplate }}</li>
    41→              <li><strong>Available Templates:</strong> {{ availableTemplates.join(\', \') }}</li>
    42→            </ul>
    43→          </div>
    44→
    45→          <div class="debug-section">
    46→            <h3>Sample Data Structure</h3>
    47→            <pre class="code-block">{{ JSON.stringify(sampleData, null, 2) }}</pre>
    48→          </div>
    49→        </div>
    50→      </UCard>
    51→    </UContainer>
    52→  </div>
    53→</template>
    54→
    55→<script setup lang="ts">
    56→import { useTemplate } from \'~/composables/useTemplate\'
    57→import type { ParsedData } from \'~/composables/useXmlParser\'
    58→
    59→/**
    60→ * Debug Template Page
    61→ *
    62→ * This page demonstrates the Modern template rendering with comprehensive
    63→ * sample data covering all template sections and edge cases.
    64→ */
    65→
    66→// Get the active template from the template system
    67→const {
    68→  getCurrentTemplate,
    69→  getCurrentTemplateMetadata,
    70→  getAvailableTemplates,
    71→  activeTemplate,
    72→} = useTemplate()
    73→
    74→const activeTemplateComponent = getCurrentTemplate()
    75→const templateMetadata = getCurrentTemplateMetadata()
    76→const availableTemplates = getAvailableTemplates()
    77→
    78→/**
    79→ * Comprehensive sample data covering all template sections
    80→ *
    81→ * This data structure matches the ParsedData interface from useXmlParser.ts
    82→ * and includes edge cases like:
    83→ * - Long names
    84→ * - Multiple experience entries
    85→ * - Multiple achievements per experience
    86→ * - Various address formats
    87→ */
    88→const sampleData: ParsedData = {
    89→  formatStyle: \'modern\',
    90→  applicant: {
    91→    name: \'Jane Doe\',
    92→    address: {
    93→      street: \'123 Main Street\',
    94→      city: \'Springfield\',
    95→      state: \'IL\',
    96→      zipCode: \'62704\',
    97→    },
    98→    contactInformation: {
    99→      phone: \'(555) 123-4567\',
   100→      email: \'jane.doe@email.com\',
   101→    },
   102→  },
   103→  date: \'June 15, 2024\',
   104→  recipient: {
   105→    position: \'Hiring Manager\',
   106→    company: \'Brightwave Marketing\',
   107→    address: {
   108→      street: \'789 Market Avenue\',
   109→      city: \'Chicago\',
   110→      state: \'IL\',
   111→      zipCode: \'60601\',
   112→    },
   113→  },
   114→  letter: {
   115→    salutation: \'Dear Hiring Manager,\',
   116→    introduction:
   117→      \'I am writing to express my interest in the Marketing Coordinator position at Brightwave Marketing, as advertised on your company website. With a strong background in digital marketing and a passion for creative storytelling, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to your team.\',
   118→    experienceSection: [
   119→      {
   120→        employer: \'GreenLeaf Promotions\',
   121→        achievements: [
   122→          { text: \'Managed multiple successful social media campaigns that increased engagement by 150%\' },
   123→          { text: \'Contributed to brand development strategies for 5 major clients\' },
   124→          { text: \'Coordinated promotional events with budgets exceeding $50,000\' },
   125→        ],
   126→      },
   127→      {
   128→        employer: \'TechStart Solutions\',
   129→        achievements: [
   130→          { text: \'Led content marketing initiatives resulting in 200% growth in organic traffic\' },
   131→          { text: \'Developed and executed email marketing campaigns with 35% open rates\' },
   132→          { text: \'Collaborated with cross-functional teams to launch new product lines\' },
   133→        ],
   134→      },
   135→    ],
   136→    motivation:
   137→      \'What excites me most about Brightwave Marketing is your commitment to creative and data-driven strategies. Your recent campaign for sustainable brands particularly resonates with my personal values and professional interests.\',
   138→    closing:
   139→      \'Thank you for considering my application. I welcome the opportunity to further discuss how my skills and experiences align with the needs of your company.    141→  },
   142→}

   145→useHead({
   146→  title: \'Template Demo - ohmydoc\',
   147→  meta: [
   148→    {

   150→      content: \'Template rendering demonstration page for ohmydoc XML-to-HTML transformer\',

   249→  font-size: 0.95rem;
   250→}
   251→
   252→.code-block {
   253→  background: var(--color-gray-100);
   254→  border: 1px solid var(--color-gray-200);
   255→  border-radius: 0.375rem;
   256→  padding: 1rem;
   257→  overflow-x: auto;
   258→  font-family: \'Monaco\', \'Courier New\', monospace;
   259→  font-size: 0.85rem;
   260→  line-height: 1.5;
   261→  color: var(--color-gray-800);
   262→  margin: 0;
   263→}
   264→
   265→/* Responsive adjustments */
   266→@media (max-width: 768px) {
   267→  .page-title {
   268→    font-size: 1.5rem;
   269→  }
   270→
   271→  .template-preview {
   272→    padding: 1rem;
   273→  }
   274→}
   275→</style>
   276→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
The file /home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/pages/debug/template.vue has been updated. Here\'s the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
     1→<template>
     2→  <div class="debug-template-page">
     3→    <!-- Page Header with @nuxt/ui -->
     4→    <header class="page-header">
     5→      <UContainer>
     6→        <div class="header-content">
     7→          <h1 class="page-title">Template Renderer Demo</h1>
     8→          <p class="page-description">
     9→            Test and compare all available templates with comprehensive sample data.
    10→            Switch between templates or view all templates side-by-side for comparison.
    11→          </p>
    12→        </div>
    13→      </UContainer>
    14→    </header>
    15→
    16→    <!-- Template Preview Section -->
    17→    <UContainer>
    18→      <!-- Template Selection Controls -->
    19→      <div class="template-controls">
    20→        <div class="control-section">
    21→          <label for="template-select" class="control-label">Select Template:</label>
    22→          <USelectMenu
    23→            id="template-select"
    24→            v-model="selectedTemplate"
    25→            :options="templateOptions"
    26→            value-attribute="value"
    27→            option-attribute="label"
    28→            class="template-select"
    29→          />
    30→        </div>
    31→
    32→        <div class="control-section">
    33→          <UButton
    34→            :color="viewMode === \'single\' ? \'primary\' : \'gray\'"
    35→            variant="solid"
    36→            @click="viewMode = \'single\'"
    37→          >
    38→            Single View
    39→          </UButton>
    40→          <UButton
    41→            :color="viewMode === \'comparison\' ? \'primary\' : \'gray\'"
    42→            variant="solid"
    43→            @click="viewMode = \'comparison\'"
    44→          >
    45→            Side-by-Side Comparison
    46→          </UButton>
    47→        </div>
    48→      </div>
    49→
    50→      <!-- Single Template View -->
    51→      <div v-if="viewMode === \'single\'" class="single-view">
    52→        <div class="template-info">
    53→          <UBadge color="blue" variant="subtle" size="lg">
    54→            {{ currentTemplateMetadata.displayName }}
    55→          </UBadge>
    56→          <p class="template-description">{{ currentTemplateMetadata.description }}</p>
    57→        </div>
    58→
    59→        <div class="template-preview">
    60→          <component :is="currentTemplateComponent" :data="sampleData" />
    61→        </div>
    62→      </div>
    63→
    64→      <!-- Side-by-Side Comparison View -->
    65→      <div v-else class="comparison-view">
    66→        <div
    67→          v-for="template in allTemplates"
    68→          :key="template.name"
    69→          class="comparison-column"
    70→        >
    71→          <div class="template-info">
    72→            <UBadge color="blue" variant="subtle" size="md">
    73→              {{ template.metadata.displayName }}
    74→            </UBadge>
    75→            <p class="template-description">{{ template.metadata.description }}</p>

  "content": "[ToolUseBlock(id='toolu_01UUgTQvuSPKPYH86C7KC3J6', name='Read', input={'file_path': '/home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/CLAUDE.md', 'limit': 100})]",

USERMESSAGE 04:30:50
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
     1→# CLAUDE.md
     2→
     3→This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4→
     5→## Project Overview
     6→
     7→This is **ohmydoc-v2**, an XML-to-HTML real-time transformer application built with Nuxt.js. The app provides a dual-panel interface where users can edit XML documents in a Monaco editor (left panel) and see instant HTML preview rendering (right panel). It's designed for document formatting (e.g., cover letters, resumes) with template-based rendering using Vue Single File Components.
     8→
     9→**Current Status**: MVP planning complete. Ready to begin MVP 1 implementation.
    10→
    11→## Essential Commands
    12→
    13→### Development
    14→```bash
    15→npm run dev          # Start dev server at http://localhost:3000
    16→npm run build        # Build for production
    17→npm run preview      # Preview production build locally
    18→npm run postinstall  # Prepare Nuxt (runs automatically after install)
    19→```
    20→
    21→### Installation
    22→```bash
    23→npm install          # Install dependencies
    24→```
    25→
    26→## Architecture
    27→
    28→### Core Technology Stack
    29→- **Framework**: Nuxt 4.1.3 (Vue 3.5.22)
    30→- **Language**: TypeScript 5.9.3
    31→- **UI Components**: @nuxt/ui for application chrome (buttons, inputs, modals, alerts)
    32→- **Styling**: Vue Scoped CSS for document templates (exportable content)
    33→- **XML Parsing**: Native browser DOMParser API
    34→- **Code Editor**: Monaco Editor (via nuxt-monaco-editor)
    35→- **Linting**: ESLint with @nuxt/eslint
    36→
    37→### Key Architectural Patterns
    38→
    39→#### 1. Styling Separation (@nuxt/ui vs Scoped CSS)
    40→**Critical Design Decision**: Two distinct styling approaches coexist:
    41→- **Application UI**: Uses @nuxt/ui components (AppHeader, XmlEditor wrapper, PreviewPanel wrapper, modals, alerts)
    42→  - Professional, accessible components out-of-the-box
    43→  - NOT included in HTML export
    44→- **Document Templates**: Use scoped CSS only (CoverLetterModern.vue, CoverLetterClassic.vue, etc.)
    45→  - Must be exportable as standalone HTML
    46→  - Each template has own `styles.css` file
    47→  - CSS referenced from `docs/sample/styles.css`
    48→
    49→#### 2. Template-Based Rendering System
    50→The application uses Vue SFCs as transformation templates:
    51→- Each template in `/templates/{name}/` is a complete Vue component with its own HTML structure and scoped CSS
    52→- Templates consume the same XML data structure but render completely different HTML outputs
    53→- Template switching is handled at code level via `composables/useTemplate.ts` (PoC limitation)
    54→- CSS is template-specific and swaps entirely when templates change
    55→
    56→**Important**: Multiple templates can render the same XML data with completely different semantic HTML (e.g., Modern uses `<article>/<header>`, Classic might use `<table>`, Minimal uses plain `<div>`).
    57→
    58→#### 3. Agile MVP Development Approach
    59→Development follows 12 progressive MVPs, each delivering a working, testable component:
    60→- **MVP 1-5**: Foundation (app shell, parser, template, editor, preview components)
    61→- **MVP 6**: Integration (dual-panel main app)
    62→- **MVP 7-9**: Core features (export, editor actions, zoom)
    63→- **MVP 10-11**: Enhancement (panel resize, additional templates)
    64→- **MVP 12**: Production-ready (accessibility, cross-browser)
    65→
    66→**See `docs/MVP-PLAN.md` for detailed breakdown of each MVP.**
    67→
    68→#### 4. Demo Pages at `/debug/*`
    69→Components are first built and tested in isolation at debug routes:
    70→- `/debug/parser` - XML parser testing (MVP 2)
    71→- `/debug/template` - Template rendering showcase (MVP 3)
    72→- `/debug/editor` - Monaco editor testing (MVP 4)
    73→- `/debug/preview` - Preview panel with error handling (MVP 5)
    74→
    75→These demo pages remain in production as live documentation.
    76→
    77→#### 5. Data Flow Architecture
    78→```
    79→User Input → XmlEditor Component → v-model binding →
    80→Debounced watcher (300ms) → useXmlParser composable →
    81→Parsed Data Object → Template Component (props) →
    82→Vue renders → PreviewPanel displays
    83→```
    84→
    85→#### 6. Composables Pattern
    86→The app uses Vue composables for shared logic (no Pinia/Vuex):
    87→- `useTemplate.ts`: Template configuration and selection
    88→- `useXmlParser.ts`: XML parsing and validation using DOMParser
    89→- `useExport.ts`: HTML export with embedded CSS
    90→
    91→### Project Structure
    92→
    93→```
    94→/pages
    95→  index.vue                    # Main application page (MVP 6)
    96→  /debug
    97→    parser.vue                 # XML parser demo (MVP 2)
    98→    template.vue               # Template renderer demo (MVP 3)
    99→    editor.vue                 # Editor component demo (MVP 4)
   100→    preview.vue                # Preview panel demo (MVP 5)

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

   100→    preview.vue                # Preview panel demo (MVP 5)
   101→/components
   102→  XmlEditor.vue                # Monaco editor wrapper (@nuxt/ui + Monaco)
   103→  PreviewPanel.vue             # Preview container (@nuxt/ui wrapper)
   104→  AppHeader.vue                # Header with action buttons (@nuxt/ui)
   105→/templates
   106→  /modern
   107→    CoverLetterModern.vue      # Modern template (default, scoped CSS)
   108→    styles.css                 # Modern-specific styles
   109→  /classic
   110→    CoverLetterClassic.vue     # Classic template (scoped CSS)
   111→    styles.css                 # Classic-specific styles
   112→  /minimal
   113→    CoverLetterMinimal.vue     # Minimal template (scoped CSS)
   114→    styles.css                 # Minimal-specific styles
   115→/composables
   116→  useTemplate.ts               # Template selection config
   117→  useXmlParser.ts              # XML→Object parser
   118→  useExport.ts                 # HTML export logic
   119→/public
   120→  samples/
   121→    cover-letter.xml           # Default sample (copied from docs/sample/)
   122→/docs
   123→  PRD.md                       # Complete product requirements (v3.0)
   124→  MVP-PLAN.md                  # 12 MVP breakdown with acceptance criteria
   125→  DECISIONS.md                 # Architectural decisions and rationale
   126→  sample/
   127→    cover-letter.xml           # Reference XML structure
   128→    styles.css                 # Reference CSS for templates
   129→```
   130→
   131→### XML Data Schema
   132→
   133→The application expects this XML structure:
   134→```xml
   135→<applicationDocument>
   136→  <applicant>
   137→    <name>...</name>
   138→    <address>
   139→      <street>...</street>
   140→      <city>...</city>
   141→      <state>...</state>
   142→      <zipCode>...</zipCode>
   143→    </address>
   144→    <contactInformation>
   145→      <phone>...</phone>
   146→      <email>...</email>
   147→    </contactInformation>
   148→  </applicant>
   149→  <date>...</date>
   150→  <recipient>
   151→    <position>...</position>
   152→    <company>...</company>
   153→    <address>...</address>
   154→  </recipient>
   155→  <letter>
   156→    <salutation>...</salutation>
   157→    <introduction>...</introduction>
   158→    <experienceSection>
   159→      <experience>
   160→        <employer>...</employer>
   161→        <achievements>
   162→          <achievement>...</achievement>
   163→        </achievements>
   164→      </experience>
   165→    </experienceSection>
   166→    <motivation>...</motivation>
   167→    <closing>...</closing>
   168→    <signature>...</signature>
   169→  </letter>
   170→</applicationDocument>
   171→```
   172→
   173→The parser in `useXmlParser.ts` transforms this into a typed JavaScript object that templates consume via props.
   174→
   175→## Adding New Templates
   176→
   177→To add a new template (e.g., "elegant"):
   178→
   179→1. Create directory: `templates/elegant/`

But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

USERMESSAGE 04:31:07
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
   175→## Adding New Templates
   176→
   177→To add a new template (e.g., "elegant"):
   178→
   179→1. Create directory: `templates/elegant/`
   180→2. Create `CoverLetterElegant.vue` with same Props interface as existing templates
   181→3. Create `styles.css` with template-specific styling
   182→4. Import and register in `composables/useTemplate.ts`:
   183→   ```typescript
   184→   import ElegantTemplate from \'~/templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue\';
   185→
   186→   const templates = {
   187→     modern: ModernTemplate,
   188→     classic: ClassicTemplate,
   189→     elegant: ElegantTemplate
   190→   };
   191→
   192→   const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \'elegant\';  // Switch here
   193→   ```
   194→
   195→Templates must accept Props interface matching the parsed XML data structure (see PRD.md section 5.2.3).
   196→
   197→## Styling Strategy
   198→
   199→### Application UI (@nuxt/ui)
   200→Use @nuxt/ui components for all application chrome:
   201→- Buttons, inputs, modals, alerts, dropdowns
   202→- AppHeader, navigation elements
   203→- Error messages, loading states
   204→- **Never use @nuxt/ui inside template components**
   205→
   206→### Document Templates (Scoped CSS)
   207→Each template defines its own styling:
   208→- Reference: `docs/sample/styles.css`
   209→- Color palette: `--ink: #111`, `--muted: #555`, `--accent: #0f6fec`
   210→- Typography: `--font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, serif`
   211→- Templates must be exportable as standalone HTML (no @nuxt/ui dependency)
   212→
   213→## Development Workflow
   214→
   215→### When Implementing MVPs
   216→1. **Read the MVP plan first**: Check `docs/MVP-PLAN.md` for the specific MVP you\'re implementing
   217→2. **Check acceptance criteria**: Each MVP has clear acceptance criteria that must be met
   218→3. **Build demo pages first** (MVP 2-5): Components are built in `/debug/*` pages before integration
   219→4. **Test in isolation**: Demo pages allow testing components independently
   220→5. **Follow the sequence**: MVPs have dependencies (see dependency diagram in MVP-PLAN.md)
   221→6. **Mark as complete**: Only mark MVP complete when all acceptance criteria pass
   222→
   223→### Key Development Principles
   224→- **Agile**: Each MVP delivers a working, usable feature
   225→- **Component Reusability**: Demo components are reused in main app
   226→- **No global state**: Use composables and component-level state (ref, computed)
   227→- **Accessibility first**: WCAG 2.1 Level AA from day one
   228→- **@nuxt/ui for UI**: Don\'t build buttons/inputs from scratch
   229→
   230→## Development Notes
   231→
   232→- This is a **Proof of Concept** - template switching is code-level only (no UI switcher)
   233→- App is pure frontend, no backend required
   234→- Default sample XML loads automatically from `public/samples/cover-letter.xml`
   235→- Debouncing (300ms) optimizes real-time preview performance
   236→- HTML export includes only template CSS (no @nuxt/ui styles)
   237→- Target document size: < 100KB XML files
   238→- Minimum supported viewport: 1024px (desktop-first)
   239→- Demo pages at `/debug/*` remain in production as documentation
   240→
   241→## Important Files
   242→
   243→**Must Read Before Starting**:
   244→- `docs/MVP-PLAN.md` - 12 MVP breakdown with acceptance criteria (start here!)
   245→- `docs/DECISIONS.md` - Architectural decisions and rationale (understand the "why")
   246→- `docs/PRD.md` - Complete product requirements (v3.0, updated for MVP approach)
   247→
   248→**Reference**:
   249→- `docs/sample/cover-letter.xml` - Reference XML structure
   250→- `docs/sample/styles.css` - Reference CSS for templates
   251→- `public/samples/cover-letter.xml` - Sample loaded by app (copied from docs/sample/)
   252→
   253→**Configuration**:
   254→- `nuxt.config.ts` - Nuxt configuration (modules: @nuxt/eslint, @nuxt/ui)
   255→- `tsconfig.json` - TypeScript project references for Nuxt
   256→
   257→## Constraints
   258→
   259→- Must be pure frontend (browser-only)
   260→- XML structure is standardized (no `formatStyle` attribute)
   261→- No backend, authentication, or database
   262→- Browser support: Chrome/Edge/Firefox/Safari (latest 2 versions)
   263→- Performance target: < 100ms transformation for documents up to 50KB
   264→
   265→## Task Master AI Instructions
   266→**Import Task Master\'s development workflow commands and guidelines, treat as if import is in the main CLAUDE.md file.**
   267→@./.taskmaster/CLAUDE.md
   268→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

{
  "content": "[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='toolu_01YWsH35qaVd5sqTrYbLaP6a', content='   175\u2192## Adding New Templates\\n   176\u2192\\n   177\u2192To add a new template (e.g., \"elegant\"):\\n   178\u2192\\n   179\u21921. Create directory: `templates/elegant/`\\n   180\u21922. Create `CoverLetterElegant.vue` with same Props interface as existing templates\\n   181\u21923. Create `styles.css` with template-specific styling\\n   182\u21924. Import and register in `composables/useTemplate.ts`:\\n   183\u2192   ```typescript\\n   184\u2192   import ElegantTemplate from \\'~/templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue\\';\\n   185\u2192\\n   186\u2192   const templates = {\\n   187\u2192     modern: ModernTemplate,\\n   188\u2192     classic: ClassicTemplate,\\n   189\u2192     elegant: ElegantTemplate\\n   190\u2192   };\\n   191\u2192\\n   192\u2192   const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \\'elegant\\';  // Switch here\\n   193\u2192   ```\\n   194\u2192\\n   195\u2192Templates must accept Props interface matching the parsed XML data structure (see PRD.md section 5.2.3).\\n   196\u2192\\n   197\u2192## Styling Strategy\\n   198\u2192\\n   199\u2192### Application UI (@nuxt/ui)\\n   200\u2192Use @nuxt/ui components for all application chrome:\\n   201\u2192- Buttons, inputs, modals, alerts, dropdowns\\n   202\u2192- AppHeader, navigation elements\\n   203\u2192- Error messages, loading states\\n   204\u2192- **Never use @nuxt/ui inside template components**\\n   205\u2192\\n   206\u2192### Document Templates (Scoped CSS)\\n   207\u2192Each template defines its own styling:\\n   208\u2192- Reference: `docs/sample/styles.css`\\n   209\u2192- Color palette: `--ink: #111`, `--muted: #555`, `--accent: #0f6fec`\\n   210\u2192- Typography: `--font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, serif`\\n   211\u2192- Templates must be exportable as standalone HTML (no @nuxt/ui dependency)\\n   212\u2192\\n   213\u2192## Development Workflow\\n   214\u2192\\n   215\u2192### When Implementing MVPs\\n   216\u21921. **Read the MVP plan first**: Check `docs/MVP-PLAN.md` for the specific MVP you\\'re implementing\\n   217\u21922. **Check acceptance criteria**: Each MVP has clear acceptance criteria that must be met\\n   218\u21923. **Build demo pages first** (MVP 2-5): Components are built in `/debug/*` pages before integration\\n   219\u21924. **Test in isolation**: Demo pages allow testing components independently\\n   220\u21925. **Follow the sequence**: MVPs have dependencies (see dependency diagram in MVP-PLAN.md)\\n   221\u21926. **Mark as complete**: Only mark MVP complete when all acceptance criteria pass\\n   222\u2192\\n   223\u2192### Key Development Principles\\n   224\u2192- **Agile**: Each MVP delivers a working, usable feature\\n   225\u2192- **Component Reusability**: Demo components are reused in main app\\n   226\u2192- **No global state**: Use composables and component-level state (ref, computed)\\n   227\u2192- **Accessibility first**: WCAG 2.1 Level AA from day one\\n   228\u2192- **@nuxt/ui for UI**: Don\\'t build buttons/inputs from scratch\\n   229\u2192\\n   230\u2192## Development Notes\\n   231\u2192\\n   232\u2192- This is a **Proof of Concept** - template switching is code-level only (no UI switcher)\\n   233\u2192- App is pure frontend, no backend required\\n   234\u2192- Default sample XML loads automatically from `public/samples/cover-letter.xml`\\n   235\u2192- Debouncing (300ms) optimizes real-time preview performance\\n   236\u2192- HTML export includes only template CSS (no @nuxt/ui styles)\\n   237\u2192- Target document size: < 100KB XML files\\n   238\u2192- Minimum supported viewport: 1024px (desktop-first)\\n   239\u2192- Demo pages at `/debug/*` remain in production as documentation\\n   240\u2192\\n   241\u2192## Important Files\\n   242\u2192\\n   243\u2192**Must Read Before Starting**:\\n   244\u2192- `docs/MVP-PLAN.md` - 12 MVP breakdown with acceptance criteria (start here!)\\n   245\u2192- `docs/DECISIONS.md` - Architectural decisions and rationale (understand the \"why\")\\n   246\u2192- `docs/PRD.md` - Complete product requirements (v3.0, updated for MVP approach)\\n   247\u2192\\n   248\u2192**Reference**:\\n   249\u2192- `docs/sample/cover-letter.xml` - Reference XML structure\\n   250\u2192- `docs/sample/styles.css` - Reference CSS for templates\\n   251\u2192- `public/samples/cover-letter.xml` - Sample loaded by app (copied from docs/sample/)\\n   252\u2192\\n   253\u2192**Configuration**:\\n   254\u2192- `nuxt.config.ts` - Nuxt configuration (modules: @nuxt/eslint, @nuxt/ui)\\n   255\u2192- `tsconfig.json` - TypeScript project references for Nuxt\\n   256\u2192\\n   257\u2192## Constraints\\n   258\u2192\\n   259\u2192- Must be pure frontend (browser-only)\\n   260\u2192- XML structure is standardized (no `formatStyle` attribute)\\n   261\u2192- No backend, authentication, or database\\n   262\u2192- Browser support: Chrome/Edge/Firefox/Safari (latest 2 versions)\\n   263\u2192- Performance target: < 100ms transformation for documents up to 50KB\\n   264\u2192\\n   265\u2192## Task Master AI Instructions\\n ASSISTANTMESSAGE 04:31:31
Edit TOOL CALL 
{
  "file_path": "/home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/CLAUDE.md",
  "old_string": "## Adding New Templates\n\nTo add a new template (e.g., \"elegant\"):\n\n1. Create directory: `templates/elegant/`\n2. Create `CoverLetterElegant.vue` with same Props interface as existing templates\n3. Create `styles.css` with template-specific styling\n4. Import and register in `composables/useTemplate.ts`:\n   ```typescript\n   import ElegantTemplate from '~/templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue';\n\n   const templates = {\n     modern: ModernTemplate,\n     classic: ClassicTemplate,\n     elegant: ElegantTemplate\n   };\n\n   const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = 'elegant';  // Switch here\n   ```\n\nTemplates must accept Props interface matching the parsed XML data structure (see PRD.md section 5.2.3).",
  "new_string": "## Template System (MVP 11)\n\n### Available Templates\n\nThe application now includes three templates demonstrating different layout approaches:\n\n1. **Modern** (default): Professional design using semantic HTML (`<article>`, `<header>`) with modern styling\n2. **Classic**: Traditional table-based layout with uppercase headers and formal styling\n3. **Minimal**: Clean, minimalist design with simple div structure and generous whitespace\n\nAll templates:\n- Accept the same `ParsedData` props interface for consistency\n- Use only scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui dependencies)\n- Are exportable as standalone HTML\n- Render the same XML data with different visual presentations\n\n### Testing Templates\n\nVisit `/debug/template` to:\n- Switch between templates using the dropdown selector\n- View all templates side-by-side for comparison\n- See how the same XML data renders across different templates\n- Debug template rendering with comprehensive sample data\n\n### Switching the Active Template\n\nTo change the template used throughout the application:\n\n1. Open `composables/useTemplate.ts`\n2. Modify the `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE` constant:\n   ```typescript\n   const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = 'modern'  // Options: 'modern', 'classic', 'minimal'\n   ```\n3. Save the file - the app will hot-reload with the new template\n\n### Adding New Templates\n\nTo add a new template (e.g., \"elegant\"):\n\n1. **Create directory structure**:\n   ```bash\n   mkdir -p templates/elegant\n   ```\n\n2. **Create the template component** (`templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue`):\n   ```vue\n   <template>\n     <div class=\"elegant-document\">\n       <!-- Your HTML structure here -->\n       <h1>{{ data.applicant.name }}</h1>\n       <!-- ... more template code ... -->\n     </div>\n   </template>\n\n   <script setup lang=\"ts\">\n   import type { ParsedData } from '~/composables/useXmlParser'\n\n   interface Props {\n     data: ParsedData\n   }\n\n   defineProps<Props>()\n   </script>\n\n   <style scoped>\n   @import './styles.css';\n   </style>\n   ```\n\n3. **Create the stylesheet** (`templates/elegant/styles.css`):\n   ```css\n   /* Use the design system variables */\n   :root {\n     --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, \"Times New Roman\", Times, serif;\n     --ink: #111;\n     --muted: #555;\n     --accent: #0f6fec;\n   }\n\n   .elegant-document {\n     /* Your styles here */\n   }\n   ```\n\n4. **Register the template** in `composables/useTemplate.ts`:\n   ```typescript\n   import ElegantTemplate from '~/templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue'\n\n   const templates: TemplateRegistry = {\n     modern: { component: CoverLetterModern, metadata: {...} },\n     classic: { component: CoverLetterClassic, metadata: {...} },\n     minimal: { component: CoverLetterMinimal, metadata: {...} },\n     elegant: {\n       component: ElegantTemplate,\n       metadata: {\n         name: 'elegant',\n         displayName: 'Elegant',\n         description: 'Your template description here',\n       },\n     },\n   }\n   ```\n\n5. **Update the debug page** (`pages/debug/template.vue`):\n   Add your template to the `allTemplates` array so it appears in the template selector and comparison view.\n\n6. **Test your template**:\n   - Set `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = 'elegant'` in `useTemplate.ts` to test in main app\n   - Visit `/debug/template` to test in isolation and compare with other templates\n   - Verify all XML sections render correctly\n   - Check responsive behavior and print styles\n\n### Template Requirements\n\nAll templates **must**:\n- Accept `Props` interface with `data: ParsedData` property\n- Use scoped CSS only (no @nuxt/ui components)\n- Handle optional fields gracefully (use `v-if` for conditional rendering)\n- Be exportable as standalone HTML\n- Follow the design system color palette and typography\n- Include print-optimized styles (`@media print`)\n- Be responsive (`@media` queries for mobile)\n\nSee existing templates (`CoverLetterModern.vue`, `CoverLetterClassic.vue`, `CoverLetterMinimal.vue`) as reference implementations."
}

CoverLetterMinimal, metadata: {...} },\\n     elegant: {\\n       component: ElegantTemplate,\\n       metadata: {\\n         name: \\'elegant\\',\\n         displayName: \\'Elegant\\',\\n         description: \\'Your template description here\\',\\n       },\\n     },\\n   }\\n   ```\\n\\n5. **Update the debug page** (`pages/debug/template.vue`):\\n   Add your template to the `allTemplates` array so it appears in the template selector and comparison view.\\n\\n6. **Test your template**:\\n   - Set `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \\'elegant\\'` in `useTemplate.ts` to test in main app\\n   - Visit `v-if` for conditional rendering)\\n- Be exportable as standalone HTML\\n- Follow the design system color palette and typography\\n- Include print-optimized styles (`@media print`)\\n- Be responsive
