USERMESSAGE 04:31:31
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
The file /home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/CLAUDE.md has been updated. Here\'s the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
   171→```
   172→
   173→The parser in `useXmlParser.ts` transforms this into a typed JavaScript object that templates consume via props.
   174→
   175→## Template System (MVP 11)
   176→
   177→### Available Templates
   178→
   179→The application now includes three templates demonstrating different layout approaches:
   180→
   181→1. **Modern** (default): Professional design using semantic HTML (`<article>`, `<header>`) with modern styling
   182→2. **Classic**: Traditional table-based layout with uppercase headers and formal styling
   183→3. **Minimal**: Clean, minimalist design with simple div structure and generous whitespace
   184→
   185→All templates:
   186→- Accept the same `ParsedData` props interface for consistency
   187→- Use only scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui dependencies)
   188→- Are exportable as standalone HTML
   189→- Render the same XML data with different visual presentations
   190→
   191→### Testing Templates
   192→
   193→Visit `/debug/template` to:
   194→- Switch between templates using the dropdown selector
   195→- View all templates side-by-side for comparison
   196→- See how the same XML data renders across different templates
   197→- Debug template rendering with comprehensive sample data
   198→
   199→### Switching the Active Template
   200→
   201→To change the template used throughout the application:
   202→
   203→1. Open `composables/useTemplate.ts`
   204→2. Modify the `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE` constant:
   205→   ```typescript
   206→   const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \'modern\'  // Options: \'modern\', \'classic\', \'minimal\'
   207→   ```
   208→3. Save the file - the app will hot-reload with the new template
   209→
   210→### Adding New Templates
   211→
   212→To add a new template (e.g., "elegant"):
   213→
   214→1. **Create directory structure**:
   215→   ```bash
   216→   mkdir -p templates/elegant
   217→   ```
   218→
   219→2. **Create the template component** (`templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue`):
   220→   ```vue
   221→   <template>
   222→     <div class="elegant-document">
   223→       <!-- Your HTML structure here -->
   224→       <h1>{{ data.applicant.name }}</h1>
   225→       <!-- ... more template code ... -->
   226→     </div>
   227→   </template>
   228→
   229→   <script setup lang="ts">
   230→   import type { ParsedData } from \'~/composables/useXmlParser\'
   231→
   232→   interface Props {
   233→     data: ParsedData
   234→   }
   235→
   236→   defineProps<Props>()
   237→   </script>
   238→
   239→   <style scoped>
   240→   @import \'./styles.css\';
   241→   </style>
   242→   ```
   243→
   244→3. **Create the stylesheet** (`templates/elegant/styles.css`):
   245→   ```css
   246→   /* Use the design system variables */
   247→   :root {
   248→     --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, "Times New Roman", Times, serif;
   249→     --ink: #111;
   250→     --muted: #555;
   251→     --accent: #0f6fec;
   252→   }
   253→
   254→   .elegant-document {
   255→     /* Your styles here */
   256→   }
   257→   ```
   258→
   259→4. **Register the template** in `composables/useTemplate.ts`:
   260→   ```typescript
   261→   import ElegantTemplate from \'~/templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue\'
   262→
   263→   const templates: TemplateRegistry = {
   264→     modern: { component: CoverLetterModern, metadata: {...} },
   265→     classic: { component: CoverLetterClassic, metadata: {...} },
   266→     minimal: { component: CoverLetterMinimal, metadata: {...} },
   267→     elegant: {
   268→       component: ElegantTemplate,
   269→       metadata: {
   270→         name: \'elegant\',
   271→         displayName: \'Elegant\',
   272→         description: \'Your template description here\',
   273→       },
   274→     },
   275→   }
   276→   ```
   277→
   278→5. **Update the debug page** (`pages/debug/template.vue`):
   279→   Add your template to the `allTemplates` array so it appears in the template selector and comparison view.
   280→
   281→6. **Test your template**:
   282→   - Set `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \'elegant\'` in `useTemplate.ts` to test in main app
   283→   - Visit `/debug/template` to test in isolation and compare with other templates
   284→   - Verify all XML sections render correctly
   285→   - Check responsive behavior and print styles
   286→
   287→### Template Requirements
   288→
   289→All templates **must**:
   290→- Accept `Props` interface with `data: ParsedData` property
   291→- Use scoped CSS only (no @nuxt/ui components)
   292→- Handle optional fields gracefully (use `v-if` for conditional rendering)
   293→- Be exportable as standalone HTML
   294→- Follow the design system color palette and typography
   295→- Include print-optimized styles (`@media print`)
   296→- Be responsive (`@media` queries for mobile)
   297→
   298→See existing templates (`CoverLetterModern.vue`, `CoverLetterClassic.vue`, `CoverLetterMinimal.vue`) as reference implementations.
   299→
   300→## Styling Strategy
   301→
   302→### Application UI (@nuxt/ui)
▶ VIEW RAW DATA

  "content": "[ToolResultBlock(tool_use_id='toolu_01Seg4kB5c6akFjw5k6wPs9g', content='The file /home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/CLAUDE.md has been updated. Here\\'s the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:\\n   171\u2192```\\n   172\u2192\\n   173\u2192The parser in `useXmlParser.ts` transforms this into a typed JavaScript object that templates consume via props.\\n   174\u2192\\n   175\u2192## Template System (MVP 11)\\n   176\u2192\\n   177\u2192### Available Templates\\n   178\u2192\\n   179\u2192The application now includes three templates demonstrating different layout approaches:\\n   180\u2192\\n   181\u21921. **Modern** (default): Professional design using semantic HTML (`<article>`, `<header>`) with modern styling\\n   182\u21922. **Classic**: Traditional table-based layout with uppercase headers and formal styling\\n   183\u21923. **Minimal**: Clean, minimalist design with simple div structure and generous whitespace\\n   184\u2192\\n   185\u2192All templates:\\n   186\u2192- Accept the same `ParsedData` props interface for consistency\\n   187\u2192- Use only scoped CSS (no @nuxt/ui dependencies)\\n   188\u2192- Are exportable as standalone HTML\\n   189\u2192- Render the same XML data with different visual presentations\\n   190\u2192\\n   191\u2192### Testing Templates\\n   192\u2192\\n   193\u2192Visit `/debug/template` to:\\n   194\u2192- Switch between templates using the dropdown selector\\n   195\u2192- View all templates side-by-side for comparison\\n   196\u2192- See how the same XML data renders across different templates\\n   197\u2192- Debug template rendering with comprehensive sample data\\n   198\u2192\\n   199\u2192### Switching the Active Template\\n   200\u2192\\n   201\u2192To change the template used throughout the application:\\n   202\u2192\\n   203\u21921. Open `composables/useTemplate.ts`\\n   204\u21922. Modify the `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE` constant:\\n   205\u2192   ```typescript\\n   206\u2192   const ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \\'modern\\'  // Options: \\'modern\\', \\'classic\\', \\'minimal\\'\\n   207\u2192   ```\\n   208\u21923. Save the file - the app will hot-reload with the new template\\n   209\u2192\\n   210\u2192### Adding New Templates\\n   211\u2192\\n   212\u2192To add a new template (e.g., \"elegant\"):\\n   213\u2192\\n   214\u21921. **Create directory structure**:\\n   215\u2192   ```bash\\n   216\u2192   mkdir -p templates/elegant\\n   217\u2192   ```\\n   218\u2192\\n   219\u21922. **Create the template component** (`templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue`):\\n   220\u2192   ```vue\\n   221\u2192   <template>\\n   222\u2192     <div class=\"elegant-document\">\\n   223\u2192       <!-- Your HTML structure here -->\\n   224\u2192       <h1>{{ data.applicant.name }}</h1>\\n   225\u2192       <!-- ... more template code ... -->\\n   226\u2192     </div>\\n   227\u2192   </template>\\n   228\u2192\\n   229\u2192   <script setup lang=\"ts\">\\n   230\u2192   import type { ParsedData } from \\'~/composables/useXmlParser\\'\\n   231\u2192\\n   232\u2192   interface Props {\\n   233\u2192     data: ParsedData\\n   234\u2192   }\\n   235\u2192\\n   236\u2192   defineProps<Props>()\\n   237\u2192   </script>\\n   238\u2192\\n   239\u2192   <style scoped>\\n   240\u2192   @import \\'./styles.css\\';\\n   241\u2192   </style>\\n   242\u2192   ```\\n   243\u2192\\n   244\u21923. **Create the stylesheet** (`templates/elegant/styles.css`):\\n   245\u2192   ```css\\n   246\u2192   /* Use the design system variables */\\n   247\u2192   :root {\\n   248\u2192     --font-body: ui-serif, Georgia, \"Times New Roman\", Times, serif;\\n   249\u2192     --ink: #111;\\n   250\u2192     --muted: #555;\\n   251\u2192     --accent: #0f6fec;\\n   252\u2192   }\\n   253\u2192\\n   254\u2192   .elegant-document {\\n   255\u2192     /* Your styles here */\\n   256\u2192   }\\n   257\u2192   ```\\n   258\u2192\\n   259\u21924. **Register the template** in `composables/useTemplate.ts`:\\n   260\u2192   ```typescript\\n   261\u2192   import ElegantTemplate from \\'~/templates/elegant/CoverLetterElegant.vue\\'\\n   262\u2192\\n   263\u2192   const templates: TemplateRegistry = {\\n   264\u2192     modern: { component: CoverLetterModern, metadata: {...} },\\n   265\u2192     classic: { component: CoverLetterClassic, metadata: {...} },\\n   266\u2192     minimal: { component: CoverLetterMinimal, metadata: {...} },\\n   267\u2192     elegant: {\\n   268\u2192       component: ElegantTemplate,\\n   269\u2192       metadata: {\\n   270\u2192         name: \\'elegant\\',\\n   271\u2192         displayName: \\'Elegant\\',\\n   272\u2192         description: \\'Your template description here\\',\\n   273\u2192       },\\n   274\u2192     },\\n   275\u2192   }\\n   276\u2192   ```\\n   277\u2192\\n   278\u21925. **Update the debug page** (`pages/debug/template.vue`):\\n   279\u2192   Add your template to the `allTemplates` array so it appears in the template selector and comparison view.\\n   280\u2192\\n   281\u21926. **Test your template**:\\n   282\u2192   - Set `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE = \\'elegant\\'` in `useTemplate.ts` to test in main app\\n   283\u2192   - Visit `/debug/template` to test in isolation and compare with other templates\\n   284\u2192   - Verify all XML sections render correctly\\n   285\u2192   - Check responsive behavior and print styles\\n   286\u2192\\n   287\u2192### Template Requirements\\n   288\u2192\\n   289\u2192All templates **must**:\\n   290\u2192- Accept `Props` interface with `data: ParsedData` property\\n   291\u2192- Use scoped CSS only (no @nuxt/ui components)\\n   292\u2192- Handle optional fields gracefully (use `v-if` for conditional rendering)\\n   293\u2192- Be exportable as standalone HTML\\n   294\u2192- Follow the design system color palette and typography\\n   295\u2192- Include print-optimized styles (`@media print`)\\n   296\u2192- Be responsive (`@media` queries for mobile)\\n   297\u2192\\n   298\u2192See existing templates (`CoverLetterModern.vue`, `CoverLetterClassic.vue`, `CoverLetterMinimal.vue`) as reference implementations.\\n   299\u2192\\n   300\u2192## Styling Strategy\\n   301\u2192\\n   302\u2192### Application UI (@nuxt/ui)', is_error=None)]",
  "parent_tool_use_id": null

with simple div structure\n\n**Template System Enhancements:**\n- Updated composables/useTemplate.ts to register all three templates\n- Enhanced ACTIVE_TEMPLATE constant documentation with template descriptions\n- All templates use the same ParsedData props interface for consistency\n\n**Debug Page Improvements:**\n- Added template selection dropdown for switching between templates\n- {
  "command": "gh pr create --title \"feat: Add Classic and Minimal templates (Task 11)\" --body \"$(cat <<'EOF'\n## Summary\n\nThis PR implements **Task 11 - Additional Templates (Classic & Minimal)**, demonstrating the template extensibility of the ohmydoc application.\n\n### Templates Added\n\n1. **Classic Template** (`templates/classic/`)\n   - Traditional table-based layout with formal styling\n   - Uppercase headers and border accents\n   - Professional appearance for formal documents\n\n2. **Minimal Template** (`templates/minimal/`)\n   - Clean, minimalist design with simple div structure\n   - Generous whitespace for enhanced readability\n   - Modern, understated aesthetic\n\n### Template System Enhancements\n\n- \u2705 Updated `composables/useTemplate.ts` to register all three templates\n- \u2705 Enhanced `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE` constant documentation with descriptions\n- \u2705 All templates use the same `ParsedData` props interface for consistency\n- \u2705 Template metadata includes name, display name, and description\n\n### Debug Page Improvements\n\n- \u2705 Added template selection dropdown to switch between templates\n- \u2705 Implemented side-by-side comparison view for all three templates\n- \u2705 Enhanced UI with view mode toggle (Single/Comparison)\n- \u2705 Responsive design for mobile viewing\n\n### Documentation\n\n- \u2705 Comprehensive template system documentation in `CLAUDE.md`\n- \u2705 Step-by-step guide for adding new templates\n- \u2705 Template requirements and best practices\n- \u2705 Testing instructions for `/debug/template` page\n\n## Technical Details\n\n- All templates accept the same `ParsedData` props interface\n- Scoped CSS only (no @nuxt/ui dependencies in templates)\n- Exportable as standalone HTML\n- Print-optimized styles included\n- Responsive design with mobile breakpoints\n\n## Test Plan\n\n- [x] Linting passes without errors\n- [x] Dev server starts successfully\n- [x] All three templates render correctly\n- [x] Template switching works via `ACTIVE_TEMPLATE` constant\n- [x] Debug page dropdown allows template selection\n- [x] Side-by-side comparison view displays all templates\n- [x] Templates handle all XML sections properly\n- [x] Responsive behavior verified\n- [x] No console errors or warnings\n\n## Subtasks Completed\n\n- \u2705 **11.1**: Create Classic Template with Table-based Layout\n- \u2705 **11.2**: Create Minimal Template with Simple Div Structure\n- \u2705 **11.3**: Update Template System for Multi-template Support\n- \u2705 **11.4**: Enhance Debug Page with Template Selection\n- \u2705 **11.5**: Create Template Documentation and Usage Guide\n\n## Screenshots/Demo\n\nVisit `/debug/template` to:\n- Switch between templates using the dropdown\n- View all templates side-by-side for comparison\n- See how the same XML data renders differently across templates\n\n## Related\n\n- Closes Task 11 from Task Master\n- Follows MVP 11 specification from `docs/MVP-PLAN.md`\n\n\ud83e\udd16 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)\nEOF\n)\"",
  "description": "Create pull request with detailed summary"
}

design with mobile breakpoints\\n\\n## Test Plan\\n\\n- [x] Linting passes without errors\\n- [x] Dev server starts successfully\\n- [x] All three templates render correctly\\n- [x] Template switching
